unnormalised: A massive fire broke out yesterday at the Municipal Corporation office located at 123, Linking Road, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra, PIN 400050. The blaze, which started around 2:30 PM, quickly engulfed several floors of the building, sending plumes of thick, black smoke billowing into the sky. Initial reports suggest that the fire may have been triggered by a short circuit in the records room on the 3rd floor.
normalised: A massive fire broke out yesterday at the Municipal Corporation office located at one hundred and twenty three, Linking Road, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra, P-I-N four hundred thousand and fifty. The blaze, which started around two thirty P-M, quickly engulfed several floors of the building, sending plumes of thick, black smoke billowing into the sky. Initial reports suggest that the fire may have been triggered by a short circuit in the records room on the third floor.

unnormalised: Firefighters from the Mumbai Fire Brigade, stationed at the regional command center at 456, SV Road, Andheri West, Mumbai, 400058, were immediately dispatched to the scene. A total of 20 fire engines and 15 water tankers were deployed to combat the inferno. Despite their best efforts, the fire raged for over six hours, causing extensive damage to the building and its contents.
normalised: Firefighters from the Mumbai Fire Brigade, stationed at the regional command center at four hundred and fifty six, S-V Road, Andheri West, Mumbai, four hundred thousand and fifty eight, were immediately dispatched to the scene. A total of twenty fire engines and fifteen water tankers were deployed to combat the inferno. Despite their best efforts, the fire raged for over six hours, causing extensive damage to the building and its contents.

unnormalised: “We received the first call at 2:35 PM and our teams were on the ground within minutes,” said a spokesperson for the Mumbai Fire Brigade, whose main office is located at 789, Byculla Fire Station, Near JJ Hospital, Mumbai, 400008. “The intensity of the fire made it difficult to control, but our firefighters worked tirelessly to prevent it from spreading to nearby buildings.”
normalised: “We received the first call at two thirty five P-M and our teams were on the ground within minutes,” said a spokesperson for the Mumbai Fire Brigade, whose main office is located at seven hundred and eighty nine, Byculla Fire Station, Near J-J Hospital, Mumbai, four hundred thousand and eight. “The intensity of the fire made it difficult to control, but our firefighters worked tirelessly to prevent it from spreading to nearby buildings.”

unnormalised: The cause of the fire is still under investigation, but officials suspect that a lack of proper safety measures may have contributed to the rapid spread of the flames. The Municipal Corporation building, which also houses several other government offices, including the local branch of the Income Tax Department at Aayakar Bhavan, Bandra Kurla Complex, Mumbai, 400051, had reportedly not undergone a fire safety audit in over five years.
normalised: The cause of the fire is still under investigation, but officials suspect that a lack of proper safety measures may have contributed to the rapid spread of the flames. The Municipal Corporation building, which also houses several other government offices, including the local branch of the Income Tax Department at Aayakar Bhavan, Bandra Kurla Complex, Mumbai, four hundred thousand and fifty one, had reportedly not undergone a fire safety audit in over five years.

unnormalised: Fortunately, there were no casualties reported in the incident. All employees and visitors were safely evacuated from the building before the fire could cause any harm. However, several important documents and records were destroyed in the blaze, which could potentially disrupt the functioning of the Municipal Corporation for several weeks.
normalised: Fortunately, there were no casualties reported in the incident. All employees and visitors were safely evacuated from the building before the fire could cause any harm. However, several important documents and records were destroyed in the blaze, which could potentially disrupt the functioning of the Municipal Corporation for several weeks.

unnormalised: The Maharashtra government has announced a high-level inquiry into the incident, to be headed by a senior IAS officer. The inquiry will focus on determining the exact cause of the fire, identifying any lapses in safety protocols, and recommending measures to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future. The Chief Minister’s office, situated at Mantralaya, Nariman Point, Mumbai, 400021, has also promised to provide all necessary assistance to the Municipal Corporation in restoring its operations.
normalised: The Maharashtra government has announced a high-level inquiry into the incident, to be headed by a senior I-A-S officer. The inquiry will focus on determining the exact cause of the fire, identifying any lapses in safety protocols, and recommending measures to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future. The Chief Minister’s office, situated at Mantralaya, Nariman Point, Mumbai, four hundred thousand and twenty one, has also promised to provide all necessary assistance to the Municipal Corporation in restoring its operations.

unnormalised: In the wake of the fire, questions are being raised about the safety standards of government buildings across the city. Activists are calling for stricter enforcement of fire safety regulations and regular audits to ensure the safety of employees and the public. The incident serves as a stark reminder of the importance of fire prevention and preparedness, especially in densely populated urban areas like Mumbai. The local police station at Bandra Police Station, Linking Road, Bandra West, Mumbai, 400050 is currently assisting with crowd control and maintaining order in the area.

Activists are calling for stricter enforcement of fire safety regulations and regular audits to ensure the safety of employees and the public.
